availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William R. Holloway (Wayne County, Indiana and Indianapolis, Indiana, law student and private secretary to Governor Morton)

body.p: Wayne County, Indiana and Indianapolis, Indiana, law student and private secretary to Governor Morton. Indiana native. Son of David P. Holloway and Jane Ann Holloway. Married to Eliza Burbank Holloway on November 10, 1858. Father of E. P. M. Holloway. Attended school in Wayne County in 1850. Law student in Centreville, Indiana in 1860. Private secretary to Governor Morton in Indianapolis in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Wayne County, Wayne, p. 163B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Wayne County, Centreville, p. 18.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Marion County, Indianapolis, Ward 9, p. 99.
Dodd, Talbott & Parsons’ Indianapolis City Directory and Business Mirror for 1862, (H.H. Dodd & Co., Book and Job Printers and Book Binders, 1862), p. 138.
Indiana State Board of Health: Death Certificates, 1900–2011, Indianapolis, IN: Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Microfilm, 1911, Roll 8, p. 1309.
Indiana, Marriages, 1810-2001, Provo, UT: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc., 2014, Film 001838644, p. 383. https://search.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/sse.dll?dbid=60282&h=5189893&indiv=try&o_vc=Record:OtherRecord&rhSource=60525 (accessed December 18, 2018).
